Very Large Array, National Radio Astronomy Observatory

is about 20 miles west of town on US 60.  A visitor center (open daily 8:30-dusk, free) has interpretive exhibits and an orientation film.  There are occasional guided tours, and visitors can also follow a self-guided walking route around the facility.  No food is available at the VLA site.  Visitors to the Very Large Array should keep their cell / mobile phones switched off, as they interfere with radio observations; likewise with microwave ovens in camping vehicles.
